title: The Laravel Podcast
description: The Laravel Podcast brings you Laravel and PHP development news and discussion. The podcast is hosted by Matt Stauffer and regular guests include Taylor Otwell (the creator of Laravel) and Jeffrey Way (the creator of Laracasts).

items.title: Episode 53: Bigger & Better
items.content_text: In this episode, the crew talks about enterprise applications, scalability, and productivity.
items.content_html: In this episode, the crew talks about enterprise applications, scalability, and productivity.

items.title: Episode 21 - Commands, Pipelines and Packages
items.content_text: Laravel 5 is getting closer to beta and we discuss some upcoming changes as well as get into a discussion about when to use certain features of the framework and when they might be overkill.

items.title: Episode 20 - The War on CRUD
items.content_text: We talk about configuration and queue updates, architecture and CRUD apps, clients and code quality, business and app development, and a lot more.
items.content_html:
We talk about configuration and queue updates, architecture and CRUD apps, choosing the right persistence solution, and a lot more.

Watch the original Live Video Recording
items.summary: We talk about configuration and queue updates, architecture and CRUD apps, clients and code quality, business and app development, and a lot more.

items.title: Episode 19 - Live Q&A
items.content_text: This is the audio portion of our first live recorded video podcast. We took live question and answer and discussed Laravel 5 release scheduling, ORM origin story, Laravel internals, Angular/Angular 2, and more!
items.content_html:
This is the audio portion of our first live recorded video podcast. We took live question and answer and discussed Laravel 5 release scheduling, ORM origin story, Laravel internals, Angular/Angular 2, and more!

Watch the original Live Video Recording

items.title: Episode 18 - The War over PHP Annotations
items.content_text: In this episode, we discuss new Laravel 5 features including annotated routing and middlewares. We discuss some motivations and guiding forces that make Laravel what it is. Also, hints about Jeffrey and Taylor's secret new project. The referenced article by @everzet can be found here: http://everzet.com/post/99045129766/introducing-modelling-by-example

items.title: Episode 13 - Cute Tools
items.content_text: Testing, 100% minimum coverage, TDD. The consequences of long-term high-intensity focus. What does PHPSpec have to offer? The battle over Trait / Interface suffixes. Imposter Syndrome. Links to other Podcasts mentioned in this episode. http://www.thisamericanlife.org/ http://freakonomics.com/radio/ http://www.radiolab.org/ and just one extra added for relevance: elephantintheroom.io

items.title: Episode 12 - PHP isn't Java?
items.content_text: Everyone on the show is presenting at Laracon NYC. http://www.decksetapp.com/ for beautiful presentations What do people most misunderstand about Laravel? PHP is not Java? PHPStorm. It's good. So is Jetbrains. Here's a theme that makes it better(tm). https://github.com/ShawnMcCool/PHPStorm-SpacePeacock Taylor's Conspiracy Theories Twitter, it's not just for sharing your lunch. Open-Source.. Does it make sense? Database Backup Package https://github.com/heybigname/backup-manager Flysystem http://flysystem.thephpleague.com The Economics of Open-Source. Laracon EU and SURVEY SAYS. Vaprobash. Laravel.io's next version.

items.title: Episode 9 - Next Laravel Release and Listener Questions

items.content_html: We discuss Laravel 4.2, some recent PHP events, and answer listener questions.
items.summary: We discuss Laravel 4.2, some recent PHP events, and answer listener questions.

items.title: Episode 8 - LaraEverything
items.content_text: Taylor Otwell and Jeffrey Way join us and talk about what they've been working on. We discuss Laracasts and Laravel 4.1 including some focus on the Laravel documentation. Taylor also gives some information about LaraconUS.
items.content_html: Taylor Otwell and Jeffrey Way join us and talk about what they've been working on. We discuss Laracasts and Laravel 4.1 including some focus on the Laravel documentation. Taylor also gives some information about LaraconUS.

items.title: Episode 7 - CQRS, What is it even?
items.content_text: In this episode we discuss CQRS, how everyone loves Windows 8, building GUI apps with PHP, organizing a conference in 2014 and a bunch of other stuff.
items.content_html: In this episode we discuss CQRS, how everyone loves Windows 8, building GUI apps with PHP, organizing a conference in 2014 and a bunch of other stuff.
items.summary: In this episode we discuss CQRS, how everyone loves Windows 8, building GUI apps with PHP, organizing a conference in 2014 and a bunch of other stuff.

items.title: Episode 6 - Talking Business
items.content_text: In this episode we talk with Dan Syme, creator of Cartalyst, and Ian Landsman, creator of UserScape about business and the open-source world.
items.content_html: In this episode we talk with Dan Syme, creator of Cartalyst, and Ian Landsman, creator of UserScape about business and the open-source world.
items.summary: In this episode we talk with Dan Syme, creator of Cartalyst, and Ian Landsman, creator of UserScape about business and the open-source world.

items.title: Episode 5 - Laracon and Actionscript
items.content_text: In this episode Shawn McCool discusses Laracon, OOP, ActionScript and Chris' new Laravel 4 practical implementations book.
items.content_html: In this episode Shawn McCool discusses Laracon, OOP, ActionScript and Chris' new Laravel 4 practical implementations book.

items.title: Episode 4 - War Stories
items.content_text: In this episode Shawn McCool, Taylor Otwell, and Matthew Machuga discuss the upcoming Laravel conference in Amsterdam, code-base complexity and they share war stories.
items.content_html: In this episode Shawn McCool, Taylor Otwell, and Matthew Machuga discuss the upcoming Laravel conference in Amsterdam, code-base complexity and they share war stories.

items.title: Episode 3 - Packages
items.content_text: In this episode, Laravel author Taylor Otwell discusses packages with his teammate / backbone-ninja Eric Barnes and Laravel community contributor, Ryan Tablada.

items.title: Episode 2 - Testing Testing Testing
items.content_text: In this episode Shawn McCool, Taylor Otwell and Jeffrey Way discuss Laracon, architecture, testing and more. Enjoy!

items.title: Episode 1 - Hello World
items.content_text: In this first episode we're joined by Taylor Otwell, the creator of Laravel to discuss Laravel 4, and Shawn McCool to discuss Laracon EU taking place in August, 2013. Enjoy!
